Function to generate random variates of CTS distribution.

Source: R/basicfcts_TS.R
rCTS.Rd

Generates n random numbers distributed according to the classic tempered stable (CTS) distribution.

Usage

rCTS(
  n,
  alpha = NULL,
  deltap = NULL,
  deltam = NULL,
  lambdap = NULL,
  lambdam = NULL,
  mu = NULL,
  theta = NULL,
  method = "aAR",
  k = 10000,
  c = 1
)

Arguments

n

sample size (integer).

alpha

Stability parameter. A real number between 0 and 2.

deltap

Scale parameter for the right tail. A real number > 0.

deltam

Scale parameter for the left tail. A real number > 0.

lambdap

Tempering parameter for the right tail. A real number > 0.

lambdam

Tempering parameter for the left tail. A real number > 0.

mu

A location parameter, any real number.

theta

Parameters stacked as a vector.

method

A String. Either "aAR" or "SR".

k

integer: the level of truncation, if method == "SR". 10000 by default.

c

A real number. Only relevant for method == "aAR". 1 by default.

Value

Generates n random numbers.

Details

theta denotes the parameter vector (alpha, deltap, deltam, lambdap, lambdam, mu). Either provide the parameters individually OR provide theta. "aAR" stands for the approximate Acceptance-Rejection Method and "SR" for a truncated infinite shot noise series representation. "aAR" is the standard method used. For more details, see references.

References

Massing, Till (2022), 'Parametric Estimation of Tempered Stable Laws'

Kawai, R & Masuda, H (2011), 'On simulation of tempered stable random variates' doi:10.1016/j.cam.2010.12.014

Examples

rCTS(10,0.5,1,1,1,1,1,NULL,"SR",10)
#>  [1]  1.0949530  1.2604410  0.8445838  2.7872025  1.7603128 -2.7530740
#>  [7]  1.6632110  0.7319554 -0.6437221  2.4913526
rCTS(10,0.5,1,1,1,1,1,NULL,"aAR")
#>  [1]  1.5231452 -1.4030724  1.2091745  0.8281065 -1.0574188  2.0927765
#>  [7]  3.1298937 -0.3281376  1.0006738  2.4479716
